Abraham Levine Papers

1938-1948 Materials are in English. The Abraham Levine Papers (dated 1938-1948) consist of correspondence and drafts related to Abraham Levine's political activities. Levine was a rank-and-file member of Trotskyist movement, and his papers provide a window into the ways in which everyday members of the movement interpreted current affairs in the 1940s. Content Description
The Abraham Levine Papers (dated 1938-1948) consist of correspondence and drafts related to Abraham Levine's political activities. Levine was a rank-and-file member of Trotskyist movement, and his papers provide a window into the ways in which everyday members of the movement interpreted current affairs in the 1940s. His papers include correspondence with fellow members of the Trotskyist movement, and several drafts of essays reflecting on current events, international politics, and American trade and commerce from a leftist perspective.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Abraham Levine, the creator of this collection, were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in 2016 by Ellen Bitkower. These materials are governed by a Creative Commons CC0 license. Users need not secure permission from the Tamiment library to publish or reproduce materials in this collection.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning materials in this collection were moved into archvial housing and described in a collection-level finding aid. The collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were receive by the donor.
Biographical Note
Abraham Levine was a rank-and-file member of Trotskyist movement. Although Levine did not hold a leadership position in any political organization, he was an active member in New York City area Trotskyist groups including the Communist Workers' Group.
